body: It's a bug indeed, thanks for reporting it!
@yegor256 thanks. Should I pull a fix?
No, no. Someone else will do this
@yegor256 yes, of course. @asinyagin thanks for your report, 15 mins was added to your account (payment `DA2084335`)

issue.title: Gist.java:55-55: New method fork() to fork...

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body: Puzzle `1-8ecc5826` in `src/main/java/com/jcabi/github/Gist.java:55-55` has to be resolved: New method fork() to fork a gist. Let's introduce a new method, as explained in http://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#fork-a-gist. The method should be tested in a unit and integration tests. When done, remove this comment.

body: Task's budget is **30 mins** (see [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles) for explanation)
@longtimeago can you please help? Keep in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles). If you have any technical questions, don't hesitate to ask right here
@yegor256 Hi, it's weird, but I still haven't been paid for the issue. Could you please assist?
that's because the issue is not closed. ask @asinyagin to review your implementation and close the issue (if it's done)
In general, it's a responsibility of a ticket implementer to chase ticket reporter in order to get an approval when task is done. Everybody, keep this in mind for the future :)
